definition: to exceed all expectations/to come as a surprise

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: Job embraced life in unexpected, simple ways.
sentences.chinese: 乔布用出人意表的简单方式拥抱生活。

sentences.english: Job embraced life in unexpected, simple ways. He showed up for work, on time.
sentences.chinese: 乔布用出人意表的简单方式拥抱生活。

sentences.english: Life was like a box of chocolates- you never know what youhare gonna get.
sentences.chinese: 生命就像一盒巧克力，究竟每每出人意表。

definition: turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
to astonish people (with a miraculous feat)
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
to win by a surprise move
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
to prophesy with supernatural accuracy (idiom)/to have an incredible foresight
